task.title: Starting and registering a delegate using SSH

taskbody.prereq:
To succeed, the following statements about the login account used to perform this procedure must be true:
The account exists on both the master host and on the delegate host.
The account has serviced CLI privileges.
The account has either public key authentication or password authentication enabled on the master host and on the delegate host.
taskbody.context: Use this procedure to start a delegate host after upgrading to version . This procedure also includes steps to create and register the authentication credentials the delegate needs, through an SSH connection.

step.cmd: Log in to the delegate host .
Determine whether serviced is configured to start when the system starts.

choices.choice: If the result is enabled, proceed to the next step.
If the result is disabled, enter the following command: systemctl enable serviced

step.cmd: Verify the settings in the serviced configuration file.
Start serviced, and then monitor the startup.
step.info: During this startup, serviced invokes docker pull to retrieve its updated images.

stepxmp.codeblock: systemctl start serviced && journalctl -u serviced -f -o cat

step.stepresult: Do not proceed to the next step until the following message is displayed: Host Agent successfully started

step.cmd: Log out of the delegate host.
Log in to the master host .
Obtain the host ID of the delegate host started previously.

substep.cmd: Display the host IDs of all hosts.
Record the host ID of the delegate host.

step.cmd: Create authentication credentials for the delegate host, and register the credentials.
step.info: If the master and delegate host are configured for key-based access, the following command does not prompt you to add the delegate to the list of known hosts or to provide the password of the remote user account.
step.stepxmp: Replace Host-ID with the host ID of the delegate host started previously: serviced key reset --register Host-ID
